text: Share the spoils with your Lord, improving their loyalty.
Defeated warriors can be brought to realise the false path they have followed, and will thereafter follow the Great Plan.
Everything carried by servants of the Great Enemy is tainted - but perhaps some can be salvaged.
Those that fight us and survive, should not be allowed freedom in the aftermath. There is much to do in the lands we carve out here in the Wastes. Set them to work!
The Serpent-God, Sotek, looks favourably upon those who make bloody sacrifice in his name.
Making fodder of these captives will attract scavenging beasts while sating the bloodlust of your army.
There are many boons to worshipping the Prince of Pleasure... entice them to our cause.
Bolster the strength of your army by introducing your captives to the Dark Arts.
Send the captives to their homes, unspoilt… for a price. The enemy will show gratitude, allowing you to further your machinations.
Sending slaves back to the nest may bring a reward, or fend off a betrayal - at least for the time being.
Slaughter the captives in the name of the Chaos Gods!
Expose the captives to infection, then incubate and render down what is left.
Send the souls of these captives to the Dark Prince.
Defeated warriors can be persuaded to follow a victorious Lord.
Sacrifice the captives in the name of Khorne and He will grant you His gifts!
Kill 'em all! The enemy and their allies will really hate you for this, but da enemy’s enemy will appreciate it…
Take no prisoners – leave none alive!
Consume the captives to strengthen this daemonic host.
Allow these warriors to return to their realms – for a price.
Slaughter the captives in the name of the Chaos Gods!
Exterminating these captives will further the Old Ones' Great Plan.
Consume the captives to strengthen this daemonic host.
Earn some extra loot by selling the captives off! The enemy will even thank ya for not eatin' 'em alive.
Death abounds on the battlefield. The release of its energy is used to invigorate your warriors and send them forth to the fray.
Dragged to sacrifice before the herdstone, captives are ripped apart and consumed by the ever-ravenous Beastmen.
Valuable organs cannot be left  to spoil; send the Liche Priests onto the field with their jars.
We can't be fighting on empty stomachs, eat them now!
The defeated are chattle, and can be sold to the highest bidder.
Dominate these enemy minions! Let your will subsume the lingering influence of any pitiful liche before and enshrine your majesty in its place.
Force these troops to change allegiance and allow them to serve in your army.
Consume the captives to strengthen this daemonic host.
Earn some extra loot by ransoming your captives for cold, hard loot!
Press these Dawi into binding oaths and bring them into your throng.
Sacrifice the captives in the name of all Chaos Gods and the Chaos Gods will grant you their gifts!
Executing captives can further temper a force for war.
These men are our kin. If they are willing to repent their actions we should offer them a place among our ranks.
Allow these warriors to return to their realms – for a price.
Offer these captives to the Chaos Gods in return for their favour.
Enslave these fools - break them and consume their souls!
Feed them to the Dire Wolves, their corpses will no doubt come in handy later! The victims' empire and their allies will loathe you, but their enemies will like it.
Sacrifice the captives in the name of Tzeentch and He will grant you His gifts!
The murder of captives provides a pleasing and instructive entertainment.
Giving up a source of fresh flesh from vanquished captives, even with good reason, leaves an army weaker.
The Black Hunger can be assuaged by feasting on the fallen.
Ransoming captives brings its own reward, but the troops do not like it.
Send these foes back to their former masters and despicable gods. If their chieftains will not pay the wergild, then strip them of any valuables they carry. This is the Bear’s justice.
Offer these captives to the Chaos Gods in return for their favour.
Ransoming captives brings its own reward, but the troops do not like it.
Take no prisoners – leave none alive!
Reap the captives and claim their skulls!
For standing against our righteous cause, these men must pay the ultimate price. Kill them all.
Take no prisoners – leave no Asrai alive!
Spirits lost in battle are retained within their skeletal bodies, lest they flee to the Realm of Souls.
Sacrifice the captives in the name of Nurgle and He will grant you His gifts!
Allow these warriors to return to their homelands, for a ransom. Despite dipping into their treasury, the enemy will appreciate such a deed.
At battle's end the ancestors are thanked; through such veneration harmony is attained, and both body and soul are rejuvenated.
Share the spoils with your Lord, improving their loyalty.
Part of the serpentine path to the Impossible Fortress is revealed.
We have no time to coddle our enemies, especially those that fought us and were too slow to die in battle! Kill them now. Make it swift and perhaps Ursun will favour such mercy…
Earn some extra loot by ransoming your captives for cold, hard loot!
There can be no dead weight, for many grudges remain. Strip the bodies of valuables and move on.
A feast of flesh aids recovery.
Offer these captives to the Chaos Gods in return for their favour. Offering captives to the Chaos Gods ensures their favour, but your herd will be hungry and unhappy as a result.
Giving up a source of fresh flesh from vanquished captives, even with good reason, leaves an army weaker.
Looks like there’s meat for the pot, boys!
Labourers reduce the load on the troops, making recovery more swift.
Survival while fighting the Dark Gods requires a… pragmatic approach.
The benevolence of the Goddess shall reinvigorate and restore those who suffer.
Sacrifice the captives in the name of Slaanesh and He will grant you His gifts!
Send the souls of these captives to the Lord of Murder.
Slaves reduce the load on the troops, making recovery more swift.
These scraggy gits look tasty - eat 'em up and replenish the boyz with full stomachs!
Expose the captives to infection, then incubate and render down what is left.
This triumph deserves a celebration! Bring out the Bugman’s!
Consume the captives to strengthen this daemonic host.
Sacrifice these Chaos captives in the name of the gods of Kislev!
Although certainly not a chivalrous act, we can ransom these men back to their masters in return for some coin.
Send the souls of these captives to the Fly Lord.
Claim these captives for the forest.
Send the souls of these captives to the Raven God.
The ransom for these captives shall boost the coffers.
Leave no captives alive. The foe and their allies will not look upon you kindly, but their enemies will respect your decision.
Ensare these captives' souls, and the Winds will curl around the Great Conspirator.
